summary: Nineveh was an ancient city in modern-day Iraq, located near the city of Mosul. It was the capital of the Neo-Assyrian Empire and the largest city in the world for a time. The city was known for its impressive size and importance until it was destroyed in 612 BC during a war. After this, it never regained its former glory. Today, its ruins are a popular archaeological site, revealing many ancient artifacts and sculptures. The city's name is also used for a part of modern Mosul and a nearby governorate.
title: Nineveh
